meanings.definition: To bring under Soviet control or influence.
meanings.sent1: The country quickly sovietizes after the new government takes power.
meanings.sent2: The Soviet Union sought to sovietize neighboring countries during the Cold War.
meanings.sent3: The classroom sovietizes when the teacher introduces a group project.
meanings.sent4: The music festival sovietizes the entire town with its catchy tunes.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds sovietize the once sunny sky, signaling an incoming storm.

meanings.definition: To organize or manage according to the principles of Soviet communism.
meanings.sent1: The company sovietizes its operations to increase efficiency.
meanings.sent2: The government decided to sovietize the agricultural sector.
meanings.sent3: The family dinner sovietizes with everyone sharing their food equally.
meanings.sent4: The school cafeteria sovietizes the lunch line, ensuring fairness for all students.
meanings.sent5: The artist sovietizes their art studio, creating a communal space for creativity.
